result.title: B2B webshop with 200 transactions
result.description: A fully automated B2B webshop is necessary to facilitate rapid growth, scale operations and to radically decrease customer acquisition costs. The B2B webshop will be a totally new distribution channel for Repack packaging enabling scalability. A rough version of a webshop has been launched but it now needs to be further developed to enable sales and to include full automation.Task 2.1 includes the design, requirement specifications, development, implementation, testing and launch of a European wide B2B webshop in the relevant languages.The result of this task is a fully automated B2B web-shop. Webshop will be launched M6 and the objective is to have at least 50 sales transactions by M21 and 200 by M24.

result.title: Multiport Electric Vehicle Charger (Task 5.1.5, Month 36)
result.description: A laboratory scale demonstrator of 10 kW will be constructed, implementing the selected PEBB concept, which will verify the multiplexing circuit technique functionality and charging power flows. Additionally, an extra 10 kW prototype to test the integration of energy storage into the EV charge will be developed and tested.

result.title: High-speed driver with regenerative system to grid industrial demonstrator (Task 5.2.3, Month 34)
result.description: The demonstrator is a prototype of a drive fulfilling the goals described before capable of driving high speed spindles for the machine tool market and high frequency torque or linear motors. This prototype will be tested under Fagor’s facilities and characterized for validation of models (mainly thermal models). Data will be continuously gathered and transmitted to improve models at real time.

result.title: VR/AR demonstrators of deep renovation scenarios
result.description: This deliverable will demonstrate the ability to use AR/VR to engineer and plan the installations of deep renovation products. A number of VR/AR demonstrators will be set-up addressing the planned on-site execution of the real demonstration projects.

result.title: Technical power supply demonstrator for the testing of high-performance capacitors (Task 5.3.3, Month 40)
result.description: A single demonstrator is currently planned for the technical power supply for the testing of high performance capacitors. This demonstrator will be assembled at the facilities of EAAT and will be validated using high performance capacitors with output currents of over 1000A, voltages up to 800VAC and more. Various tests using a power frequency spectrum (100 or more frequencies up to 2500 Hz) will be run on the capacitors to determine the results of harmonics and other problematic occurrence resulting from renewable energy sources on the power grid on the high performance capacitors. These results will be used for the content of the report regarding the results of the demonstrator.
